project.teaser: The CIVITAS Initiative will be led by a new CIVITAS MUSE Coordination and Support Action from 2023-2027, coordinated by ICLEI Europe and involving 8 expert partners in total. This project will deliver a wide range of services to the European Commission and its funded urban...
project.objective: The CIVITAS Initiative will be led by a new CIVITAS MUSE Coordination and Support Action from 2023-2027, coordinated by ICLEI Europe and involving 8 expert partners in total. This project will deliver a wide range of services to the European Commission and its funded urban mobility-related projects, to enhance their results through further communication, capacity building and exploitation activities. These will involve and reach all parts of the urban mobility community, particularly CIVITAS project participants and EU cities. Further dissemination of the state of the art is made possible through CIVITAS MUSE by enhancing operational structures that involve wider community stakeholders such as the Secretariat, CIVINET regional and national networks, the Policy Advisory Committee, annual Conferences, a new Collective of European mobility networks, as well as improving collaboration groups between projects and their partners (and their related stakeholders and experts), at both a management and thematic/topic based level. The CIVITAS MUSE project helps to guarantee the replication of innovative solutions and results through a deployment planning cycle, working with cities through capacity building exchanges to promote solution-specific learning and broad skills development. Monitoring, extracting and communicating the most useful results and information from projects lies at the core of CIVITAS MUSE, with projects supported in employing up to date evaluation approaches. CIVITAS MUSE comes at a key time in the Smart and Climate Neutral Cities Mission and the achievement of multiple Destination goals including those under Cross-Sectoral Solutions for the Climate Transition.

result.title: Market Assessment of CIVITAS Solutions 2024
result.description: This deliverable is the output of Task 6.4, a document which sets out a Market Readiness Assessment to identify: (1) solutions ready to be deployed in the short term; (2) solutions that require additional support, (3) a content review of the existing tools. The Market Readiness Assessment will be carried out once per year.

result.title: CIVITAS Projects Bi-Annual Monitoring Results M6
result.description: Evaluation of results, implementation activities, and events of urban mobility projects - the outputs, deliverables, publications, and relevant material including communications and online (including social media, videos) that have been produced by each individual CIVITAS project will be reviewed once every 6 months, to identify priority results which can be targeted to the CIVITAS community.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CIVITAS MUSE (Mobility for Urban Sustainability and the EnvironmentCIVITAS 2030 Coordination and Support Action: Sustainable and Smart Mobility for All)
result.teaser: CIVITAS MUSE is the Coordination and Support Action for CIVITAS Initiative, succeeding CIVITAS ELEVATE in supporting CIVITAS Research and Innovation Actions, CIVITAS Innovation Actions, and the work with the CIVITAS National Networks, called CIVINETs.The project, funded by...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Conference Annual Report 2024
result.description: This deliverable will provide a report on the activities of the conference in 2024, including brief proceedings of the event.

result.title: Conference Annual Report 2023
result.description: This deliverable will provide a report on the activities of the conference in 2023, including brief proceedings of the event.

result.title: Report on Insight of EU Urban Mobility Labour Market
result.description: This is a report about the market research centred on the questions: which skills and knowledge are needed by professionals working for urban planning authorities?

result.title: CIVITAS Study Guide
result.description: This guide presents the planned capacity building activities as well as highlighting other relevant learning opportunities provided through Tasks 7.2 and 6.1.

result.title: Report on CIVITAS AGORA Matchmaking 1
result.description: This deliverable will provide a report on the CIVITAS AGORA matchmaking events.

result.title: Market Assessment of CIVITAS Solutions 2023
result.description: This deliverable is the output of Task 6.4, a document which sets out a Market Readiness Assessment to identify: (1) solutions ready to be deployed in the short term; (2) solutions that require additional support, (3) a content review of the existing tools. The Market Readiness Assessment will be carried out once per year.

result.title: CIVITAS Projects Bi-Annual Monitoring Results M12
result.description: Evaluation of results, implementation activities, and events of urban mobility projects - the outputs, deliverables, publications, and relevant material including communications and online (including social media, videos) that have been produced by each individual CIVITAS project will be reviewed once every 6 months, to identify priority results which can be targeted to the CIVITAS community.

result.title: Replication Strategy
result.description: The document will describe the take-up and transfer activities including twinning sessions, site visits (three per year or six per cycle) and co-creation workshops (both virtual and in person) to keep cities engaged for the duration. It will include information about the 24 CIVITAS Champion cities and the 12 CIVITAS Challenge cities as well as information about the call for applications. The document will be updated in M26.

result.title: Inception Report
result.description: Work plans and dependencies will be detailed, in close cooperation with CINEA and DG MOVE, to drive the achievement of MUSE objectives including: a) The Secretariat (re. Task 2.3); b) CIVINETs (re. Task 4.3-4.4); c) Policy Advisory Committee (PAC) (re. Task 4.5); d) Conferences (re. Task 4.6); e) CIVITAS projects exchange programme (re. Task 6.1), mapping and clustering of projects and setting up cooperation; f) CIVITAS strategic collaboration strategy, mapping European mobility communities/initiatives and engagement foreseen (re. Task 1.3 and 6.2); g) establishing cross-WP City Network membership growth strategy.

result.title: CIVITAS Projects Bi-Annual Monitoring Results M18
result.description: Evaluation of results, implementation activities, and events of urban mobility projects - the outputs, deliverables, publications, and relevant material including communications and online (including social media, videos) that have been produced by each individual CIVITAS project will be reviewed once every 6 months, to identify priority results which can be targeted to the CIVITAS community.

result.title: Project Handbook
result.description: The project handbook will set out the role of the internal governance processes in theproject, including Steering Groups, General Assemblies, project reviews, and how these will be managed and reported. This will include a detailed Project Management Plan with a Gantt chart and a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).It will include a schedule per task, responsible partner related subtasks, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks.

result.title: CIVITAS Evaluation Framework
result.description: This deliverable describes a common, realistic, user-friendly and effective framework as the reference point for mobility measures and concepts, supporting projects in its implementation to harmonise evaluation activities. The framework provides dedicated support to CIVITAS projects for the implementation of the evaluation activities.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Promotion Strategy
result.description: A document that provide the CIVITAS Community with practical guidance to promote the Initiative and the project outputs and activities (including an updated communications toolkit), clearly outlining the role and aspirations of the CIVITAS Initiative and to ensure it stands out from other European transport initiatives

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
